item.title: 政治风云变幻之际，经济学家判断英国脱欧法案比以往任何时候都糟糕
item.description: 关于英国脱欧的最令人沮丧的预测确实没有立即成真。【原文：It’s true the most dismal predictions about Brexit didn’t come true — immediately.】

item.title: 印度监管机构向 IndiGo 首席执行官发出 "表明理由通知"（Show-Cause Notice）。
item.description: 印度向该国最大航空公司的首席执行官发出了一份 "显示原因通知"，因为该公司近一半的航班被取消，导致数千名乘客滞留在各个机场。【原文：India issued a show-cause notice to the chief executive officer of the nation’s biggest carrier after cancellations affected almost half of its flights, leaving thousands of passengers stranded at various airports.】

item.title: 礼来和辉瑞入选中国首批民营保险公司名单
item.description: 礼来公司、辉瑞公司和强生公司入选了中国首批创新药物目录，为昂贵的前沿疗法开辟了新的市场渠道并提升了销售前景。【原文：Eli Lilly & Co., Pfizer Inc. and Johnson & Johnson secured spots on China’s first innovative drug catalog, opening a new market channel and boosting sales prospects for costly, cutting-edge treatments.】

item.title: 中国人民银行扩大黄金购买，金属涨势降温
item.description: 周日公布的数据显示，中国央行连续第13个月增加黄金储备。【原文：China’s central bank added to its gold reserves for a 13th straight month, according to data released on Sunday.】

item.title: 华尔街押注中国股市将延续 24 亿美元涨势
item.description: 在股市大放异彩的一年里，中国赢得了全球资金的青睐，投资者预计中国的人工智能实力和在美国紧张局势下的韧性将进一步推动股市上涨。【原文：China has won back global funds in a banner year for stocks, with investors anticipating further gains on the country’s AI prowess and resilience amid US tensions.】

item.title: 禁令临近，澳大利亚总理誓言追究社交媒体责任
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内斯提醒社交媒体公司，当禁止儿童拥有账户的禁令于周三生效时，他们将承担责任。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese reminded social media companies that they will be held responsible when a ban on children having accounts takes effect on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特朗普下令调查食品行业可能存在的价格垄断行为
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下令司法部和联邦贸易委员会调查美国食品供应链中可能存在的价格垄断和其他反竞争行为，以抬高肉类、种子和化肥等商品的成本，尤其是外国公司的价格垄断和其他反竞争行为。【原文：President Donald Trump ordered the Department of Justice and the Federal Trade Commission to investigate the US food supply chain for potential price fixing and other anti-competitive behavior to drive up costs of goods such as meat, seeds and fertilizer, especially by foreign companies.】

item.title: CyrusOne 称 CME 数据中心故障系人为失误所致
item.description: 上周末，美国芝加哥商品交易所集团（CME Group Inc.【原文：An outage that took down markets operated by CME Group Inc. for more than 10 hours at the end of last week was caused by human error at a data centers owned by CyrusOne.】

item.title: 鲍威尔有望下调美联储利率，尽管存在一些异议
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）预计将在本周再次推动降息四分之一个百分点，尽管其他政策制定者对通胀率仍然过高越来越感到不安。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is expected to push through another quarter-point interest-rate cut this week despite growing unease among fellow policymakers that inflation remains too high.】

item.title: 亚洲以欧元借贷，美国失去融资优势：信贷周刊
item.description: 亚洲经济体不仅在转变贸易关系以对抗美国的关税，它们还越来越多地将融资转移到其他市场，这凸显了唐纳德-特朗普总统的政策如何有可能削弱美国在集资方面的主导地位。【原文：Asian economies aren’t just shifting their trading ties to fight against US tariffs, they’re also increasingly moving their financing to other markets, underscoring how President Donald Trump’s policies risk eroding American dominance of capital raising.】

item.title: 从 2600% 的涨幅到 86% 的全军覆没，加密货币最热门交易轰然倒塌
item.description: 今年年初，股票市场上最出色的交易之一在短短几个月内变成了最糟糕的交易之一。【原文：What began the year as one of the best trades in the stock market has, in a matter of months, turned into one of the worst.】

item.title: ICICI Prudential AMC 将于 12 月 12 日启动 12 亿美元首次公开募股
item.description: 彭博社的计算显示，印度ICICI保诚资产管理公司正寻求高达1.07万亿卢比（119亿美元）的估值，因为该公司计划于12月12日启动首次公开募股。【原文：India’s ICICI Prudential Asset Management Co. is seeking a valuation of as much as 1.07 trillion rupees ($11.9 billion), calculations by Bloomberg showed, as it plans to launch its initial public offering on Dec. 12.】

item.title: 感恩节交易冲刺帮助 Netflix 赢得华纳兄弟公司
item.description: Netflix Inc. 与华纳兄弟 Discovery Inc. 达成交易的计划在感恩节前后开始成形。【原文：The Netflix Inc. plans that clinched the deal for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. started to shape up around Thanksgiving.】

item.title: 修复资本主义和尼泊尔的弊端
item.description: 在本期《华尔街周报》中，大卫-威斯汀谈论了资本主义受到审查以及尼泊尔的抗议活动。【原文：In this Wall Street Week, David Westin talks about capitalism being under scrutiny and protests in Nepal】

item.title: 美国努力振兴制造业，同时缩小中国的作用
item.description: 特朗普的工业复兴尚未实现。但他正在缩小中国的进口来源。【原文：Trump’s industrial renaissance hasn’t panned out. But he’s shrinking China as a source of imports.】

item.title: 卡塔尔称人工智能需求和投资不足可能导致液化天然气短缺
item.description: 卡塔尔能源部长表示，他 "非常担心 "投资不足和人工智能带来的能源使用激增将导致 2035 年以后液化天然气和天然气供应短缺。【原文：Qatar’s energy minister said he’s “really worried” a lack of investment and a surge in energy use from AI will create a shortage of LNG and natural gas supplies beyond 2035.】

item.title: Biocon 将完全拥有价值 55 亿美元的生物制剂部门
item.description: 印度制药公司 Biocon Ltd. 将以现金和股票相结合的方式收购 Biocon Biologics Ltd. 的少数股东，该交易对生物仿制药部门的估值为 55 亿美元。【原文：Indian pharmaceuticals firm Biocon Ltd. will buy out minority shareholders in Biocon Biologics Ltd. via a mix of cash and shares in a deal that values the biosimilars unit at $5.5 billion.】

item.title: 意大利监管机构否决了 MPS-Mediobanca 的投资者协议：Sole
item.description: 据《Il Sole 24 Ore》报道，意大利市场监管机构排除了 Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA 及其部分股东在竞购 Mediobanca SpA 时未披露的投资者协议。【原文：Italy’s market regulator ruled out the existence of an undisclosed investor pact involving Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA and some of its shareholders in its bid for Mediobanca SpA, Il Sole 24 Ore reported.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：欧洲和世界抵御关税的能力强于预期
item.description: 欧元区经济在第三季度的扩张幅度超过了最初的报告，代表了全球经济在面对美国反复无常的关税政策时表现出韧性的大趋势。【原文：The euro-area economy expanded more in the third quarter than initially reported, representative of a broader trend of the global economy proving resilient in the face of erratic US tariff policy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩在米兰金融论坛上表示通胀更有可能缓解
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）在接受《米兰金融报》（Milano Finanza）采访时表示，从中期来看，欧元区的通胀风险略有下行。【原文：Inflation risks in the euro area are slightly tilted to the downside in the medium term, European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn said in an interview with Milano Finanza.】

item.title: 在西班牙和意大利，银行推动了期待已久的股市复苏
item.description: 自金融危机期间银行导致全球股市基准暴跌至困境水平以来，已经过去了约 17 年。在西班牙和意大利，该国最大的贷款机构股价势不可挡的飙升终于抹平了这些损失。【原文：It’s been about 17 years since banks sent global equity benchmarks plunging to distressed levels during the financial crisis. In Spain and Italy, an unstoppable surge in shares of the country’s biggest lenders is finally wiping out those losses.】

item.title: 印度财政部长认为经济增长势头不减
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）表示，印度的增长势头将持续下去，政府预计在截至 3 月份的财政年度中经济将至少增长 7%。【原文：India’s growth momentum is set to continue, and the government expects the economy to expand by at least 7% in the financial year through March, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said.】

item.title: 机场入侵事件增多，德国加快反无人机措施
item.description: 飞机引擎突然再次加速，飞机开始在德国首都上空盘旋，准备在万圣节前降落柏林的乘客们大吃一惊。【原文：Airline passengers preparing to land in Berlin just in time for Halloween were in for a nasty surprise when the engines of the aircraft suddenly revved up again and the plane began circling over the German capital.】

item.title: 洪灾过后，印度尼西亚停止了阿金库尔和 PTPN III 的运行
item.description: 印度尼西亚暂停了三家公司在苏门答腊岛的业务，称将调查这些公司的土地清理活动是否引发了致命的洪水和山体滑坡，造成该岛数百人死亡。【原文：Indonesia suspended the operations of three companies in Sumatra, saying it would probe whether their land-clearing activities helped trigger the deadly floods and landslides that killed hundreds on the island.】

item.title: 日本与熊有关的伤亡人数创下攻击升级的纪录
item.description: 自 4 月份以来，日本已有 230 人被黑熊打死或打伤，创下了历史新高。随着黑熊越来越深入人类居住的地区，政府面临着更大的干预压力。【原文：A record 230 were killed or injured by bears in Japan since April, putting more pressure on the government to intervene as the animals push deeper into areas where people live.】

item.title: Netflix 向华纳支付的 58 亿美元分手费是有史以来最大的一笔分手费
item.description: Netflix 公司以 720 亿美元收购华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros. Discovery Inc.【原文：Netflix Inc.’s $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. includes one of the biggest breakup fees of all time — a $5.8 billion penalty that Netflix has agreed to pay its target if the deal falls apart or fails to win regulatory approval.】

item.title: 越南贸易顺差缩小，官方寻求美国贸易协议
item.description: 由于越南正努力与美国达成关税协议，11 月份越南的贸易顺差连续第三个月收窄。【原文：Vietnam’s trade surplus narrowed for a third straight month in November as the country works to conclude its tariff deal with the US.】

item.title: 科迪纳称迈阿密住房供应短缺影响经济承受能力
item.description: 安娜-玛丽-科迪纳（Ana-Marie Codina）的家族企业在该地区开发总体规划社区，她表示，由于住房供不应求，南佛罗里达州面临着日益严重的可负担性问题。【原文：South Florida faces a growing affordability problem as housing demand outstrips supply, according to Ana-Marie Codina, whose family firm develops master-planned communities in the region.】
